reviews.sentence: Large Hotel Room Space. I was in Washington DC for a conference earlier this week. Rouge was on the sponsored hotel list of the convention. The walk from the hotel to the convention center was about 20 minutes. It was about an equal distance to the Mall and pretty close to the White House. The hotel room was I think spacious for a big city. The room was clean and the bathroom was well appointed. The shower water temperature control and pressure was excellent. There was also a magnified and lit makeup shaving mirror in the room and a hairdryer available. The chairs in the room were uncomfortable but the bed was fine. There was very good storage space for luggage and clothes a plush Leopard robe to use ironing board and iron but no coffee maker. Instead the hotel had free prepared coffee in the lobby from 5 am to 10 am. On one morning the coffee was empty and I did not stay around to see how long it took to be refilled. In the afternoons there was complimentary wine available. Overall the stay met all expectations and I enjoyed my stay.

Great location for where we needed to go. The parking attendant very kindly went down to the garage to retrieve a forgotten article. Also the refreshments in the lobby were nice. I could not get room service or the front desk to answer. Finally called the front desk on my cell phone and it was answered right away. Placed our order with him.

Very nice hip boutique hotel. The Rouge is nice little hip boutique hotel with a great location on Embassy Row in the Dupont Circle neighborhood. It ’s a few blocks to the nearest Metro. We pulled our luggage incoming but took a taxi outgoing …. It ’s an easy walk to the White House and there are plenty of great restaurants bars galleries markets and liquor stores nearby. Love the residential feel of the neighborhood. We have traveled to DC dozens of times for both business and pleasure over the past 10 years and have stayed in many wonderful hotels in and out of the district. We love the Kimpton brand and seek them out whenever we travel coast to coast. The Rouge is one of the older Kimpton properties in the DC area and is showing some wear. I ’m thinking they may be close to requiring a bit of updating. This was our 4th or 5th time staying at the Rouge although it had been 6 years since our last. All the staff we encountered where friendly and welcoming but there was never anyone to open the door. We saw many guests us included struggling to get through the two double doors with luggage in tow. We did not have a car but witnessed other guests standing around in the cold wondering what to do with their car which looked stressful because the street is one way very narrow quite busy and lined with parallel parked cars. Weird lack of service for Kimpton …. Our King accommodation on the 7th floor was spacious and spotless. The bathroom had a tub shower combo and was tiny. They no longer offer personal Aveda bath products and have opted for the bulk bottles of shampoo conditioner and shower gel screwed to the wall in the shower. I do n’t love it reminds me of being at the gym and I feel it ’s a bit unsanitary. The bed was dreamy with top notch linens. The overall décor is Kimpton cool with a “ hipster ” type flare. It ’s very RED. Great red velvet blackout drapes. Housekeeping was great as our room was perfectly refreshed each day. I wish they would go a littler easier on the deodorizer as it was a bit strong and too sweet smelling. They should consider using scent free products. Our room faced 16th St which I requested for the street view. There is an architecturally stunning church directly across the street and the stained glass is beautiful at night ☺ Even with the hotel issues described herein the Rouge is on of the first DC area hotels we stayed in some 12 years ago. I have a soft spot for it and would recommend it especially if the price is right. However I really hope they give it some needed TLC ….

Front Desk at Rouge Rocks. When travelling to DC on business my first choice are the Kimpton properties particularly the Hotel Rouge. As a global business traveler I am tired of the mega chain hotels waking up realizing i could be anywhere in the world they all look and feel alike. That never happens when I stay at a Kimpton. Each venue is unique has it is own peculiar flair and consistently charming. The Rouge however is a standout because of it is front desk service. Hedi and Jenifer should be teaching customer service. Always a warm welcome solicitous about how the day is going and ensuring I enjoy my stay. it is more than running through their check list they make it a personal experience every time I am a guest. 5 times in the last 6 months. that is why when I have the choice I try the Rouge first. Jenifer and Hedi rock.

Nice hotel for families or business. Terrific location comfortable for family of 4. Housekeeping extremely thoughtful with arrangement of the stuffed animal collection that travelled with us and delivery of wine glasses to accompany the bottle of wine we brought.
Fab and friendly stay. Great size room and bathroom. Air con could have been better. Very hot room.
This is probably the best decor for a hotel I have gotten to see in a while. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are nicely sized.
Lovely stay but horrible area. I loved everything from the check in to the check out. Only problem my vehicle was vandalized and broke in during our stay.
Very Good. A beautiful private property and accessible. There was a problem with a leak in the bathroom that was reported resolved and a credit given to compensate.
Exceptional. The staff were amazing frotn desk and valet were very accommodating to our needs and our pets need. Big rooms clean great.

We have to stan the Kimpton Rouge. The Kimpton Rouge is IT. What an amazing hotel for such a great price. it is clean it is chic it is seductive great for couples lol. The service is amazing. Great location too. They also had a free wine hour for guests between 5 6pm when we walked in. I would HIGHLY recommend it. I did not like that I could not stay at the hotel longer.
The place is nice. Not happy about amenity fee. Not sure what the amenities were. Parking is ezpensive but it is DC.

Great staff tired hotel. My husband and I stayed at the Rouge 10 years ago during our first DC trip thinking that like all the other Kimpton hotels where we had stayed the hotel would be unique friendly and fun. At that time it was true. Now however although buoyed somewhat by a fabulous staff the hotel has sagged into itself and is tired. The location is great the hotel is clean and the staff really nice. it is just not REALLY a Kimpton at least how we know themAs for the continental breakfast. the coffee and juice are good. The pastries bagels cereal are plain wrap grocery store quality. Either improve or eliminate. I had give up the evening wine for a better breakfast.

Disappointing. i was charged 2 times for my room. in total 70 with 2 different cards the room was 400 100 hold deposit originally 200 but clerk gave me discount. 500 me an my bf split it but they charged my card 500 and his card 200 and it overdrafted my account. i was very upset because that was the money i needed to get back home and no one could help me figure it out or get my money back or even cared. this was my birthday weekend and also my first time visiting DC. so the rooms and everything was NICE but i will not ever stay here again.

You Get What You Pay For At the Kimpton Rouge. If I were to rate this hotel out of five stars I would give it two. It earns one star for being conveniently located roughly a 15 20 minute walk to the mall and the zoo in the opposite direction and one star for the complimentary services like breakfast muffins bagels hot and cold cereal assorted pastries wine and appetizers during happy hour and fruit infused water throughout the day. The overall freshness of the food and the narrow inflexible window for breakfast keeps it from earning an extra half star. It loses one star for the overall friendliness of the staff for example at check in I was not spoken to beyond being asked to pay for my visit and it loses two stars for the ridiculous guest amenity fee a 28 night charge that encompasses wi fi long distance calls and shuttles regardless of whether or not you actually use these services and regardless of the fact that there is a fee upfront to use them wi fi for example was 13. night the reason why I did not connect any of my devices. If you were going to visit DC I would recommend not compromising quality for price. My friends and I wanted a cheap hotel and that is what we got booking here.

Great location. My husband and I stayed for four nights at the Kimpton Rouge while touring DC for the first time. The location was superb because it was out of the hustle and bustle but close enough to walk or take a cheap Lyft if you wanted to. The hotel itself was eclectic nothing to complain about just different. We booked a hotel rather than Airbnb in order to get free breakfast. so we were disappointed to find the free breakfast was just cereal toast coffee and juice. We did end up ordering several meals from the restaurant on site and were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food. Service at the hotel was great. Staff were attentive and helpful especially the front desk personnel. I ’d recommend staying if you ’re looking for a cheap hotel off the main drag.

Very Good. The room was very spacious and the bed very comfortable. There was complimentary drinks in the lobby every day between 530pm7pm. Very disorganised when I asked to book a conference room for a meeting I had. The evening staff told me to speak to the morning staff and the morning staff told me the person responsible is n’t there. In the end they called me to say there was nothing available. Another minor thing no cofe tea maker in the room. You have to explicitly ask reception to bring you one.

Charming Hotel. Minus the Parking. We enjoyed our stay at the hotel. My daughters and I visited for the Fall 2019 Howard University Open House event and wanted to stay nearby the campus. We enjoyed our spacious room and good customer service. I would recommend that they improve their continental breakfast. The bagels toast were too hard. Also we paid 100 to park 49 parking fee parking tax service fee plus service tax. Very expensive. Also our room did not have updated cell phone charging ports. Luckily I brought my wall plug in charger. We also did not face any facial towels in our room but a quick call to housekeeping rectified the problem.

Funky contemporary twist on a modern hotel. It reminds me of the Axel hotels in Europe. Staff are very friendly and helpful. The overall hotel decor is a bit dated though. Great location and walkable to everything or a quick ride.
